messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Need Help! Children are confused and hurtbyunsuppo...

messages.messageBody:
>
> Well that all sounds very much in your favor on a lot of counts. I would
do
> some more checking possibly about the court systems there and the judges
and
> homeschooling. Ask around. Talk to someone in the system. Ask an attorney.
> Just in case. If what you hear is favorable, I would do as you wish.

Many lawyers around here will book a first visit for free.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Need Help! Children are confused and hurtbyunsuppo...
messages.msgSnippet: ... regarding the rearing and overall well-being of the childrens growth and development, including but not limited to, choice of school, course of study,
messages.messageBody:
>>I was awarded "custody". I says " Ann has the right and responsibility
regarding the rearing and overall well-being of the childrens growth and
development, including but not limited to, choice of school, course of
study, extensive travel away from home,..."blah blah blah... "Ann Shall not
be required to consult with Jason as to decision making on a day-to-day
basis."...>>

That part is good.

>>It also states that each of us is intitled to two weeks of uninterrupted
vistitation. It states nothing about summers. It also states that he is
allowed a min. of 2 weekends of month and that modification of increased
visits is up to me.I know he would fight me on anything else.>>

This is where you could run into problems if you move. If moving makes the
2 weekends a month impossible, he might want the whole summer. But I don't
see how he could ask for child support during that time if he is behind on
what he owes you now. And day care? That's the responsibility of the
parent they're with.
Tia
